title: The Feelings Book
author: Todd Parr
description: A vibrant, colorful book that helps young children identify and express their feelings. Uses simple language and relatable situations to normalize all emotions.

title: Hands Are Not for Hitting
author: Martine Agassi
description: Teaches children alternative ways to express frustration and anger. Emphasizes positive uses of hands like hugging, creating, and helping.

title: The Way I Feel
author: Janan Cain
description: Explores a range of emotions through rhyming text and expressive illustrations. Helps children name and understand their feelings.

title: Should I Share My Ice Cream?
author: Mo Willems
description: A humorous story about Gerald the elephant's internal debate about sharing. Great for discussing the challenges of sharing.

title: What to Do When You Worry Too Much
author: Dawn Huebner
description: An interactive self-help book that teaches children how to tame their worries using cognitive-behavioral techniques.

title: The Kissing Hand
author: Audrey Penn
description: A heartwarming story about a raccoon going to school for the first time. Provides comfort for children experiencing separation anxiety.

title: My Many Colored Days
author: Dr. Seuss
description: Uses colors and animals to represent different emotions and moods. Helps children recognize that emotions change throughout the day.

title: The Invisible String
author: Patrice Karst
description: Teaches children that even when apart from loved ones, they are always connected. Comforting for separation anxiety and loss.

title: I Can Do Hard Things
author: Gabi Garcia
description: Encourages children to embrace challenges and believe in their abilities. Promotes a growth mindset and resilience.

title: The Whole-Brain Child
author: Daniel J. Siegel
description: FOR PARENTS: Explains brain development and provides practical strategies for nurturing a child's developing mind. Evidence-based approaches to common parenting challenges.
